supporting_text: A One Health approach, which recognizes the relationships between the health of humans, animals, plants, and the environment, is integrated throughout the Plan.
The NAP mentions specific actions in the human health sector, including objectives to reduce healthcare-associated antibiotic-resistant infections.
The NAP includes objectives to monitor and report on antibiotic resistance among selected animal pathogens.
The NAP outlines objectives to establish new capacities for collecting antibiotic resistance data from the environment, including water and soil.
The NAP includes objectives to engage the animal health community and advance strategies intended to foster the responsible use of medically important antibiotics in plants and animals.
The U.S. Government will report annually on progress toward the objectives set in the Plan.
Where possible, the 2020 Plan has established targets to be achieved by 2021, with some targets set for longer timeframes.
The NAP includes specific objectives such as decreasing healthcare-associated antibiotic-resistant infections by 20 percent by 2025.
The document does not specify budget allocations for the strategies or actions.
The document does not contain an assessment of future budget requirements.
The Task Force is co-chaired by the Secretaries of the U.S. Departments of Health and Human Services, Agriculture, and Defense.
The NAP includes objectives to support national and State policies that improve the use of antibiotics across healthcare settings and communities.
The NAP includes objectives to develop new or expanded educational training guidelines and outreach activities to educate stakeholders on best practices.
The NAP includes objectives to expand the scope and reach of CDC's awareness campaigns, including Be Antibiotics Aware.
The NAP emphasizes improving international collaboration and capacities for antibiotic-resistance prevention and control.
The NAP includes objectives to expand surveillance through existing systems to monitor antibiotic resistance from multiple sources across One Health.
The NAP includes objectives to increase capacity nationwide to contain antibiotic-resistant infections and control outbreaks.
The NAP includes objectives to support further prevention of healthcare-associated infections prioritized in the National HAI Action Plan.
The NAP includes objectives to work with international partners through the Codex Alimentarius Commission's Task Force on Antimicrobial Resistance.
The NAP includes objectives to support national and State policies that improve the use of antibiotics across healthcare settings.
The NAP includes objectives to help healthcare providers adopt recommended antibiotic use practices.
The NAP includes objectives to enhance U.S. leadership in the global fight against antibiotic resistance and promote international collaborations for research.
